greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A103994 * A115361.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
formula: A103994 * A115361 as infinite lower triangular matrices.
T(n,k) = A317673(n/k) for k | n, T(n,k) = 0 otherwise. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 03 2018
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: b[n_] := Module[{e}, Sum[e = IntegerExponent[d, 2]; If[d == 2^e, MoebiusMu[n/d] Binomial[2 + e, 2], 0], {d, Divisors[n]}]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 13}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 24 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k)={ if(n%k, 0, sumdiv(n/k, d, my(e=valuation(d, 2)); if(d==1<<e, moebius(n/(k*d))*binomial(2+e,2), 0))) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 03 2018
xref: Column 1 is A317673 (Moebius transform of A129502).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 17 2007
ext: Terms a(56) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 03 2018
